article.title: The RowHammer Problem and Other Issues We May Face as Memory Becomes Denser

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary cause of the RowHammer problem in DRAM?
choices: Cosmic rays flipping bits in memory cells.
Cell-to-cell interference in scaled memory technology.
Overheating of DRAM modules due to high utilization.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is a major security threat posed by the RowHammer vulnerability?
choices: Denial of service attacks by crashing the operating system.
Remote code execution by gaining kernel privileges.
Data leakage by reading sensitive information from other programs.
Slowing down system performance by corrupting frequently accessed data.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Figure 1, when did RowHammer emerge as a significant problem in DRAM modules?
choices: It has always been a problem in DRAM modules.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is one potential reliability issue in NAND flash memory that is exacerbated by scaling to smaller technology nodes?
choices: Increased write endurance due to thinner oxide layers.
Data retention failures due to smaller cell size and reduced charge.
Faster read speeds due to reduced cell resistance.
Improved data integrity due to smaller physical dimensions.
